title: Carleman's condition
summary: In mathematics, particularly, in analysis, Carleman's condition  gives a sufficient condition for the determinacy of the moment problem. That is, if a measure μ {\displaystyle \mu } satisfies Carleman's condition, there is no other measure ν {\displaystyle \nu } having the same moments as μ . {\displaystyle \mu .} The condition was discovered by Torsten Carleman in 1922.[1]
